page.title: 07A Wolds Farm (continued)
page.content:
Colostrum in the mother's milk is essential to the calf because it contains antibodies vital to the calf's survival. My wife feeds the calves in the morning and evening. We keep the heifer calves as replacements, but the bul calves are sold to a neighbouring farmer. The calves are fed by bucket for two months before weaning.
The evening milking starts at 4.30 p.m. and I usually get in for tea at about 7.00 p.m. Later in the evening I have a last look round the cows and give them their final feed of cow nuts for the day.(continued)
